content.question: A particle starts at time t = 0 and moves along the x-axis so that its position at any time t ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = (t − 1)3(2t − 3). (a) Find the velocity of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.

frqParts.text: A particle starts at time t = 0 and moves along the x-axis so that its position at any time t ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = (t − 1)3(2t − 3). (a) Find the velocity of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.
(b) For what values of t is the velocity of the particle less than zero?
(c) Find the value of t when the particle is moving and the acceleration is zero.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
